issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description: Currently the service client code is restricting a component's target tags to include only a single tag, the component name. I have a use case for two components having anti-affinity with themselves and with each other. The YARN placement policies support this, but the service framework isn't allowing it.
fields.summary: Allow multiple tags for anti-affinity placement policy in service specification

comments.body: This patch removes the validation code in ServiceApiUtil that restricts the placement constraint tags and adds a test for multi component anti affinity. I created a new test class for this test, and I also moved the existing placement policy test from TestYarnNativeServices to the new class, TestPlacementPolicy.

Thanks for the review, [~gsaha]! Patch 4 improves the error message.

Thanks [~billie.rinaldi]. Patch 4 looks good. The documentation in swagger definition (YARN-Simplified-V1-API-Layer-For-Services.yaml), examples (YARN-Services-Examples.md) and site documentation are quite generic since it talks about the broader placement policy support. However, do you want to review them once and see if we should add some specific examples for this symmetric usecase.
